column5: So I've hit the end of a 6 day stint working around the salmon river. What a fantastic fishery.  I literally walked out of my hotel 10 minutes and was on fish. Some of the days the water was as high as 1600 cfs, but when they dropped flows down to around 700 cfs the fishing was fantastic.  Truthfully, with the exception of a few high water and cold days, the fishing was great.  Average size 'bow was about 5 lbs with my new PB being over ten.  I don't have a ton of pictures as I was fishing alone much of the time and didn't feel safe trying to tame 'bows, a 15'6" rod, and my DSLR all at once...  Here's two pics though..One is of my coworker and him holding an average salmon river steelie and the second is of my first brown (over 8 inches anyways)...  All in all, in my brief morning fishes before work I landed about 20 steelies, had my ass handed to me on a plate by a bunch more...
Nice fish matey, that is a stunning looking brown.. very clean fish. Well done
Excellent, and you fished it at just the right time. Late April drop back fishing is outstanding on the Salmon.
Tough life eh Luc? Fishing before work and scouting holes during work.  The browns are a nice bonus, havent heard of too many around here lately.
Thx for sharing....but that 2nd fish is an Atlantic isn't it
i posted this knowing someone would make the atlantic joke...hehe
HEY, I ALSO FISHED AFTER WORK SOMETIMES!
Doncha just hate working?!!  You lucky sod..  Those are beauties!  cheers HD
Great catches Doc.  I've always wanted to fish the Salmon river but never had the wheels to make it down there.  Sooo very tempting.  How long was the pinky that the brownie took?
Great report and pics Dr. Salvelinus  Real beautiful brown!!! congratulations to both of you Thanks for sharing Leechman
